Activity

In this activity determine the appropriate operating system installation technique for a given scenario.

Based on the scenario, check the most appropriate type of operating system installation.
1. <textformat blockindent='13'>Nephi has purchased a computer from a friend and wants to make sure that all of the old files and application programs are removed from the system.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>Caroline has just purchased the newest version of the operating system currently installed on her home computer.</textformat>
3. <textformat blockindent='13'>Nigel has decided that he would like to try the Linux operating system. His computer currently has Windows XP installed.</textformat>

4. <textformat blockindent='13'>Ingrid has an older laptop that she currently runs Linux on. She now would like to be able to install Windows XP on the laptop but still requires Linux to do her daily work.</textformat>

5. <textformat blockindent='13'>Preeti has just been hired by a company to do quality control work on their database application. Both Windows and Linux versions of the application are available and she must test out both versions of the application at the same time. To accomplish this Preeti has purchased a high-end computer system.</textformat>
Correct, you have identified all installation methods required. Click Next to continue.
Incorrect, review the characteristics of each installation method and try again.
